intro: Saurauia ceramica, commonly known as the Ceramica Saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its evergreen shrub form, with small, leathery leaves and clusters of white or pinkish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to habitat loss, Saurauia ceramica is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
